subject: RE: [junit] Class Loader problem?
msgSnippet: Yes, thanks, I ve tried it and it gives me the same error. I ve tried it in various forms, for example:com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.* , and also the specific:
messageBody:
Yes, thanks, I've tried it and it gives me the same error.
I've tried it in various forms, for example:com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.* , and also the specific: com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.lf.PanelToolTipUI .
-Scott

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Erik Meade [mailto:emeade@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 13, 2001 12:33 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Class Loader problem?
>
>
> Scott,
>
> Are you testing com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.lf.PanelToolTipUI? If not, what
> happens when you add it to the exluded list?
> --
> Erik Meade emeade@...
> Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
> http://www.junit.org
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Clemmons, Scott [mailto:scott.clemmons@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2001 2:53 PM
> > To: JUnit
> > Subject: [junit] Class Loader problem?
> >
> >
> > Well, I've messed with this all day now, and I'm at a standstill.
> > I'm getting a ClassCastException when I run uTest the second time
> > I run my GUI (see Stack Trace below).uTest uses the JUnit
> > framework and also includes a class loader & an exclude list. I
> > have the following packages defined in the exclude list:
> >
> > java.*
> > javax.*
> > junit.*
> > com.borland.*
> > com.inprise.*
> > com.visigenic.*
> > com.ibm.*
> > com.sun.*
> > sun.*
> > org.omg.*
> > org.apache.*
> > org.w3c.dom.*
> > org.xml.sax.*
> >
> > ===== Begining of Stack Trace =====
> > java.lang.ClassCastException:
> com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.lf.PanelToolTipUI
> > at
> >
> com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.views.PanelToolTip.updateUI(PanelToolTip
> .java:16)
> > at javax.swing.JToolTip.<init>(JToolTip.java:64)
> > at
> com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.views.PanelToolTip.<init>(PanelToolTip.java:6)
> > at
> > com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.views.GCMCStatusBar$StateLabel.<init>(GCMCSt
> > atusBar.java:341)

> > com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.views.GCMCStatusBar$StateLabel.<init>(GCMCSt
> > atusBar.java:336)
> > at
> >
> com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.views.GCMCStatusBar.<init>(GCMCStatusBar
> .java:49)
> > at
> > com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.views.NEContainerView.<init>(NEContainerView
> > .java:187)
> > at
> > com.fnc.geni.gui.gcmc.integration.GCMCComponent.initialize(GCMCCom
> > ponent.java:99)
> > at
> > com.fnc.geni.apl.ApplicationLaunchMgr.initialize(ApplicationLaunch
> > Mgr.java:239)
> > at
> > com.fnc.geni.apps.repository.RepositoryByTypeTest.setUp(Repository
> > ByTypeTest.java:41)
> > at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:138)
> > at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
> > at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
> > at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> > at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:131)

> > at utest.Runner$1.run(Runner.java:69)

> >
> > I'd appreciate any help.
> >
> > Scott
> > :-> Change is inevitable except from vending machines.
